location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 26 to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter reports news - via Latouche in Bussora [Basra] - that Great Britain has signed preliminaries of peace with Spain and France and agreed to a cessation of hostilities with Holland.The letter also outlines in detail recent events concerning the conflict between the Persia and the Arabs of Zebarra ([Zubarah] including the defeat of a Persian force that attacked Zebarra and the plunder of Bahreen [Bahrain].The letter also mentions the surrender of Mangalore to the British and discusses financial matters in some detail.
